titleStmt.title: G. T. Spilman to James F. Robinson
CWG1245

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1862-1863

body.p:
Frankfort augs 21st 1862
Gov. Robinson
Dear Sir

Knowing that you will be often cald on for Information for Subsistence of Troops I have ben Sent hear by Genl. Boyl as post commisary & have on hand all Necessary Stores & am prepard to furnish any number of troops I Learn that the Qt Master has Maid Some contracts which is not acording to any Regulation I have seen and at Rates fare above Goverment prices though you have the power to order aneything through this department -- it is parte of my duty to se that the goverment is not Swindled which I think is attempted by Partys you have not had the opportunity as yet to detect Hoping you will give this Some attention

I Remain with Dew Respect
your obedent servant
G. T. Spillman
Capt and c. s. u. s. vol
